value.title: U.S. Blacklists Dozens of Chinese Companies Working on AI, Face Recognition Tech
value.excerpt: The U.S. Commerce Department has put another 33 Chinese businesses—many of which develop artificial intelligence and face recognition tech—on its economic blacklist as a punitive measure for purportedly conspiring with Beijing and the government’s brutal crackdown on Muslim minorities.

value.title: How machines see: everything you need to know about computer vision
value.excerpt: The human vision is a very intricate piece of organic technology that involves our eyes and visual cortex, but also takes into account our mental models of objects, our abstract understanding of concepts and our personal experiences through billions and trillions of interactions we’ve made with the world in our lives.

value.title: Computer Vision Helps Scientists Study Lithium Ion Batteries

value.title: Vochi, the ‘computer vision’-based video editing and effects app, raises $1.5M seed
value.excerpt: Vochi, a startup operating out of Belarus that’s created a “computer vision”-based video editing and effects app for mobile phones, has raised $1.5 million in seed funding. Leading the round is Ukraine-based Genesis Investments (backer of BetterMe and Jiji).
